data.enText: not used in the progressive tenses
if sb/sth deserves sth, it is right that they should have it, because of the way they have behaved or because of what they are

data.chText: 辛苦劳累那么久，你该休息一下了。
data.enText: You deserve a rest after all that hard work.

data.chText: 这报告应该给予认真考虑。
data.enText: The report deserves careful consideration.

data.chText: 有一名运动员特别值得表扬。
data.enText: One player in particular deserves a mention.

data.chText: 我做了什么事应该得到这种待遇呢？
data.enText: What have I done to deserve this?
They didn't deserve to win.

data.chText: 他做了这样的事，应该终身监禁。
data.enText: He deserves to be locked up for ever for what he did.
sb deserves a medal

data.chText: （用以夸奖某人完成了艰巨任务）应给某人授勋
data.enText: used to say that you admire sb because they have done sth difficult or unpleasant
get what you deserve
deserve all/everything you get
used to say that you think sb has earned the bad things that happen to them
one good turn deserves another

data.chText: 善须善报；要以德报德；好人应得好报
data.enText: you should help sb who has helped you

simple_means.memory_skill: de 加强 + serv 服务；保持 + e → 一再保持 → 值得

ex.chText: 她在考试中作弊，应该受罚。
ex.enText: She cheated during the exam and deserves to be punished.

synonyms.bx: 指某人或某事物应该得到奖励、惩罚、关注等，不用于进行时。

ex.chText: 他很快博得了同事的尊敬。
ex.enText: He soon earned the respect of his colleagues.

ex.chText: 那次出色的表演为她赢得了“舞蹈女王”的称号。
ex.enText: The excellent performance earned her the title of 'Dancing Queen'.

synonyms.bx: 常指某人因出色表现或良好素质而赢得某事物。

data.enText: sb deserves a medal

data.chText: （用以夸奖某人完成了艰巨任务）应给某人授勋
data.enText: used to say that you admire sb because they have done sth difficult or unpleasant
get what you deserve
deserve all/everything you get
used to say that you think sb has earned the bad things that happen to them
one good turn deserves another

data.chText: 善须善报；要以德报德；好人应得好报
data.enText: you should help sb who has helped you

example: You deserve a promotion after all the hard work you have done

value.def: If you say that a person or thing deserves something, you mean that they should have it or receive it because of their actions or qualities.

example.ex: Government officials clearly deserve some of the blame as well...
example.tran: 政府官员显然也应当承担部分责任。

example.ex: They know the sport inside out, and we treat them with the respect they deserve...
example.tran: 他们对这项体育运动了如指掌，我们也给予了他们应有的尊重。

example.ex: These people deserve to make more than the minimum wage...
example.tran: 这些人应该得到比最低工资更高的报酬。

example.ex: His children's books are classics that deserve to be much better known...
example.tran: 他的儿童书非常经典，应该为更多人所知晓。

example.ex: I felt I deserved better than that...
example.tran: 我觉得自己不应受到那样的对待。

example.ex: The Park Hotel has a well-deserved reputation.
example.tran: 帕克旅馆的名声当之无愧。

value.def: If you say that someone got what they deserved, you mean that they deserved the bad thing that happened to them, and you have no sympathy for them.

example.ex: One of them said the two dead joy riders got what they deserved.
example.tran: 他们中的一个人说这两名开偷来的车去兜风的人死得活该。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to serve, to keep 服务；保持
rootsaffixes.title: serv

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 加强 + serv 服务；保持 + e → 都保持下来 → 保存 → 保存原有风俗习惯不愿破坏 → 保守
con 加强 + serv 服务；保持 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 保存；保持
con 加强 + serv 服务；保持 + ative 有…倾向（性质）的，属于…的 → 保守的
de 加强 + serv 服务；保持 + e → 一再保持 → 值得
dis 不 + serv 服务；保持 + e → 不保持 → 损害
ob 表加强 + serv 服务；保持 + ance 表状况 → 惯例；遵守
ob 表加强 + serv 服务；保持 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 保持〔看〕→ 观察
ob 表加强 + serv 服务；保持 + atory 场所 → 观察星象的场所 → 天文台
ob 加强 + serv 服务；保持 + e → 一再保持；坚持〔看〕→ 遵守
pre 预先 + serv 服务；保持 + e → 预先保留 → 保存
re 一再 + serv 服务；保持 + e → 一再保持 → 保留
re 一再 + serv 服务；保持 + ed 表形容词 → 保留的；沉默的
serv 服务；保持 + ant 表人 → 提供服务的人 → 仆人
serv 服务；保持 + ice 行为 → 服务
service 服务 + able 能…的 → 能提供服务的 → 有用的
serv 服务；保持 + ile 易于…的 →〔被迫为别人〕服务的 → 奴隶的
